result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Patrick John Hannon was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Patrick John Hannon was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED OF $259.00. Remaining balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation as to Count 3.
BAIL APPLIED TO DNA, BLOOD DRAW and TRANSCRIPT FEE. Blood costs to be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police Dept., and Transcript fee to be forwarded to the District Attorney's office.

FORTHWITH. 
With Huber, and standard release conditions.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Victim Impact Panel Meeting already completed.
To perform as a Condition of Probation to Count 3.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Patrick John Hannon in court with attorney Andrew Charles Ladd.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law.  Ct. 4 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct.  1:
- 75 days jail with Huber to commence FORTHWITH.  Huber with standard release conditions. 
- 24 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 24 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel has been complied with.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Department - append to fine. 
- Fine totaling $1494.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation on Ct. 3 - APPLY BAIL
- Transcript fee of $6.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the DA's Office - append to fine
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - append to fine
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation on Ct. 3
- Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence

Ct. 3:
- Sentence withheld for 2 years Probation -  consecutive to Ct. 1
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing on September 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
